derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (in the sense 'fearful or timid'): from Latin meticulosus, from metus 'fear'. The word came to mean 'overcareful about detail', hence the current sense (early 19th cent.)

entry.tran: 小心谨慎的;一丝不苟的;注意细节的
entry.def: If you describe someone as meticulous, you mean that they do things very carefully and with great attention to detail.

example.ex: He was so meticulous about everything...
example.tran: 他对所有事情都一丝不苟。

example.ex: The painting had been executed with meticulous attention to detail.
example.tran: 画这幅画的时候，画家非常注意细节。

means.word_mean: 1. marked by precise accordance with details;

sentences.sentence: "punctilious in his attention to rules of etiquette"

means.word_mean: 2. marked by extreme care in treatment of details;

sentences.sentence: "almost worryingly meticulous in his business formalities"
